title: Puzzle Night
description: Come hang out with us to kick off the semester! There will be the funny arithmetic sudokus, the 24 game, a bunch of logic puzzles, and possibly more, or you can just come and chat. Come help us kick off the year with some fun!

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: REU Discussions and Advising
description: An REU is a research experience for undergraduates, usually he;d diromg the summer. Our club members Katherine and Ophelia will discuss their REU experiences this past summer, as well as giving advice for those interested in doing an REU.

title: Ice Cream Social
description: The ice cream social is an event held every semester by BUMA. Come to chill, chat about math, and have some good ice cream.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session
description: We solve problems from past Putnam exams, and other difficult problems. Pizza and drinks will be provided. Hosted in collaboration with Professor Jared Weinstein.

title: A Friendly Introduction to Abstract Nonsense
description: Our club member Grant Talbert will give an introduction to category theory, which is a beautiful unifying language for mathematics. He will define the elementary notions of categories, functors, natural transformations, and universals, with motivation pulled from basic set theory and algebra. Basic knowledge of sets and functions is recommended. Lecture Notes.

title: Photon Collab: Trivia Night
description: BUMA is collaborating with Photon, the BU Physics club! We will be joining them for a trivia night.

title: Putnam Problem Solving Session

title: And more...
location: ignore the date/time it has to be there for the script to work
description: We haven't finished finalizing our schedule for the semester! Check back later for more, or contact us to get added to our weekly email list!

title: What is a quasi-category?
description: Our club member Grant Talbert will give an introductory talk on the theory of quasi-categories, which are simplicial sets that fill inner horns. They are excellent models for (∞,1)-categories, and as such have seen significant use in recent decades in fields such as homotopy theory. In this talk, Grant will define quasi-categories, and then will explain why they are excellent models for (∞,1)-categories. Lecture notes will be linked when available.
